reviews.review_msg: Dr. Calvert is not the most interesting prof, his slides are around 150 for one lecture but his learning objectives guide you for what you should be paying attention to. There are a lot of readings but you can get away with just skimming through them. He doesn't try to trick you on exams. Overall, if you are good at writing essays, you'll be fine.

Professor Calvert was an amazing professor. I took HSCI 305 as an intersession so it was understandable that material had to be rushed through, but I still enjoyed it. If you put in the work, do your readings and attend class you will do well. The course has a lot of readings, but he also gives questions for guidance. He is also very approachable.

Dr. Calvert is such a sweetheart, and is really understanding and reasonable towards students. He does assign a lot of readings and his exams and assignments are all essay-based, however his expectations are straight-forward and his marking is fair. He is easy to communicate with and I would take another class with him in a heartbeat.

John is a kindhearted man and he is passionate about whatever he teaches. He cares a lot for all of his students and will help them whenever he can. He gave out A LOT of readings, especially since it's intersession AND online, so it was a lot to handle (a bit overwhelming considering its 6hrs lectures/wk). Overall, I def recommend him!

John is a great prof, he cares about the topics he teaches and is incredibly knowledgeable in these areas, which makes his lectures worthwhile. There is a lot of reading in this course (2 mid-length articles per week ) and a lot of info but if you study and pay attention, you will do well! he is also very unbiased and open to all opinion, love him!

This is my second time taking a course with him, and I must say this course was definitely a lot heavier than 305. He's definitely very passionate in what he teaches and I respect him a lot for that. I think his exams are more than fair as within every questions you have the option to pick which part you want to answer + he def cares about students

John Calvert has no authority, he sat at the center of the room, and spoke in a monotone voice. For the final group project, we went to him for feedback, he insisted that we were doing everything correctly, but with the final grade I got, I couldn't have gotten more than 60% on the project. His lectures had 300 students, but only 30 would attend.

This class was SO EASY!!! John is such a sweet guy, the class legit only has 2 ONLINE quizzes, no midterms or final exams! There is a video group project which was a piece of cake! The lectures were long but the material was very interesting and John was sympathetic with us being that it was a night lecture and almost always let us go early!
Tough marker, boring, make us do all the work, he just sits there and watch.

HSCI 160 John Calvert is boring and uninteresting. Lecture material is straight out of the textbook. In fact, attending lectures could replace the need for reading the text. The class is curved so expect your A+ to drop to a B if it's not above 97%. The assignments are pointless and quiz questions can be answered using Google.

I've taken three classes with Dr. Calvert (HSCI 305, 404 and 407) and he's a great prof! His lectures are a bit long, dry and boring and he gives out a lot of readings, but the material is really interesting! Gives great feedback and is always accessible! He's really passionate about the topics, wants to help students and make sure they're informed

A lot of writing in this course, it should be considered a W course. Other than that John Calvert is an awesome prof, highly respected and shows a positive attitude towards his students. I didn't find his marking subjective at all and got As on all my papers and assignments - read the text thoroughly and you'll do great in this class.

Interesting class besides the fact that the marking is very subjective. Write your exams/essays based on what HE thinks is correct (your opinion never matters, it is all about him). This is evident in his comments: "I do not like this, I do not understand this, I provided better examples etc.". Keep this in mind and you should do okay.

Excellent professor, very clear, and made the subject matter extremely interesting for students and presented both sides in an unbiased matter. Straightforward papers & exams, very fair marking schemes. I learned a lot from Dr. Calvert, I wish more professors were like him. If you have the opportunity to do 305 with Dr. Calvert seize it!

He really likes to communicate with his students. He a replies to student's emails as soon as possible. Also, he tells you how you can acquire a good mark, so just follow what he says. It is true that this class has a lot of essays to hand in, but TA does not mark them hard. I highly recommend you to take this class with Dr. John Calvert.

John is a great prof. Lectures did feel long and the material was kind of dry but John made it bearable by using lots of videos. There were two short papers and one 12 page paper but marking was very fair (slightly easy). Midterm & final were more essay writing but you have choice in what you want to answer so it's ok if you don't study everything.

Overall this class was good! Lots of readings (but you don't have to do them all - mainly just stick to the textbook which is really good!). He does mark for participation where you have to sign in which is worth 5% of the grade. Lots of writing. 3 papers - one that is 12 pages. Plus the midterm and final are essays. But overall super interesting!

Although this class has lots of reading, his lectures are so informative that studying just of those is enough to do well on the essay exams. Although 3 hours is a long time to learn about the Canadian Health Care System his lectures are well planned and the slides are information packed! He knows his stuff and you will to after taking this class!

Very enthusiastic about the course. Lots of writing in the course but he makes sure to go over the topics thoroughly so you know what he is talking about. Very available for help, and gives you lots of options for questions to answer on exams in case you do not remember certain topics.

He really is an excellent prof and a great guy.  Really wants you to do well and provides tons of feedback for papers.  Exams are fair and are direct from lectures. He's really passionate about the material which makes him care about your progress.
very bad prof, goes through each slide in 2 seconds, not helpful, not considerate to students' needs, speaks in monotone, lectures are boring as hell
very interesting class about government role in healthcare. if you are a health major take this class. great professor with great attitude and fair exams.
Great Class! I didn't know that I was interested in the topic until I took the course

Great Prof! There's a lot of material to learn but it's a pretty interesting course.  He's a really nice guy and wants you to do well.  He offers many different questions to choose from on the final so it's okay if you missed some of the readings.
Lectures are a bit boring but he is very forgiving by putting very many options on the final exam. You can most likely get by spending lots of time on certain sections of the course...
So dry and boring
He is very helpful and has interesting ideas to talk about.

EXCELLENT PROF! He wants everyone to do well. Gives lots of options when doing papers and exams. Picks interesting topics to talk about. Encourages people to ask questions and give comments. NEVER puts students down - VERY nice guy and he's always smiling and happy.
Amazing professor - you will not regret taking a course with him. The topic is not for everyone, but the professor is as good as they come :)

Teaches HSCI 305-The Canadian Health System. He is THE best prof at SFU. He genuinely wants everyone to do well and to learn lots. Chooses very interesting topics and is big on group work. Very interesting to talk to and provides lots of feedback on papers.

This professor wants all of his students to learn and do well.  He picks very interesting readings and puts them all on webct, so you aren't running around looking for things.  He encourages you to do your paper on whatever you're interested in.  He's got a heart of gold.  Best professor at SFU!
Very good teaching style. I was wary at first about the group work, but it proved to be very helpful in the laerning process. Take this professor!

Energy and the environment. This was an extermely interesting course. Don't let the group work turn you off, Calvert is the best prof I have ever had. Every environmnetalist should have to take this course!

Overall, a good professor, able to communicate material easily. His lecture style can be somewhat tedious at times, but I think given the extremely dry and relatively uninteresting material we studied, Prof. Calvert did a good job.

John is a great prof, and though I am not a big fan of political science readings, the readings in this class were actually pretty interesting and helpful.  He is a fair marker and is very helpful and genuinely cares about students.
John is a very helpful professor. Sure it helps to love CUPE, to do the countless readings, and to participate. Overall-a fair marker, but watch out: he gets technical like an english teacher!

Great prof, marks fair, allows for plenty of feedback concerning the course, and really looks like he wants to help his students succeed. The readings were interesting, even though there were a lot of them. However, the class is biased towards the left of the political spectrum, which I found did not take away from the course's overall quality.

John is a great teacher... he knows and loves what he teaches.... he is helpful and is always willing to help... take a class with him but be ready and willing to learn cause there are a lot of readings

I found John to be an intelligent and helpful teacher that marks fair and is open to all points of view. You can see his bias, however if students do not agree with his side of the political spectrum (& therefore the readings) he encourages them to challenge and add to the discussion. Overall I found his classes to be intellectually stimulating!
Very knowledgeable, very approachable and helpful.. however, class is often a reiteration of the textbook. If you're a policy junkie or domestic politcalhead, you'll like this guy.
Highly knowledgable. Readings are good overall, though there are A LOT of'em. Disregard the aforementioned negative feedback. Smart people will like this class. Very reasonable marker.Recommended.

Highly engaging class. Having guest speakers every week is a nice touch.The readings for the seminar are a)thoughtful b)accessible. If you have the option, I highly recommend taking courses taught by John.

Professors don't come any worse than John Calvert.  Rediculously boring lectures, rediculously boring readings.  If I didn't need the credits towards graduation, I would have dropped this course.  If you can, avoid him.  If you can't, then God help you.
Totally a nice man, but his lectures are awful! Worse than watching the grass grow.  Maybe if you would use a computer rather than 30 overhead slides!
Really nice man, with lots of information.  Easy marker, but boring lectures.

If you don't mind less-than-subtle attempts to indoctrinate you into embracing the labour movement, in 4 hour doses once a week, than Calvert is your man! We had three guest speakers, all of them union representatives... so much for critical thought.
Pretty boring lecture, but he is a nice guy who knows his stuff. A looooot of readings!
NICE guy but hard...
